t: Amazon Suspends Amazon-Native Brands Mpow and Aukey - Marketplace Pulse
s: May 11, 2021 - Amazon has suspended over a dozen Chinese sellers for participating in fake review schemes. The list includes Mpow and Aukey, two of the biggest electronics Amazon-native brands out of China. The total sales by the suspended sellers eclipses $1 billion.

t: Amazon takes down another popular tech accessory company, following Aukey, Mpow
s: April 21, 2022 - A month removed from reports that Amazon had removed two extremely popular tech accessory brands — Aukey and Mpow — from its store due to involvement with a fraudulent reviews system, another huge name has disappeared. RAVPower, one of the key competitors to Aukey and Mpow, has received ...

t: Amazon-first gadget brands Aukey and Mpow are suddenly, suspiciously disappearing | The Verge
s: May 10, 2021 - Many Amazon listings for two major electronics sellers, Aukey and Mpow, have mysteriously disappeared as of Monday afternoon. It’s unclear exactly what might be going on.

t: Your favorite accessory brand may have left Amazon due to fake reviews (Update)
s: May 12, 2021 - Original article: May 10, 2021 ... There might be a good reason for it. Amazon has pulled AUKEY and Mpow from its listings not long after a SafetyDetective investigation found companies paying for fake reviews to boost sales....

t: Aukey and Mpow accessories disappear from Amazon - CNET
s: May 10, 2021 - Amazon has stripped dozens of listings for popular accessories makers like Aukey and Mpow from its online store amid published reports potentially tying the companies to a scam that involved paying users for positive reviews of their products. The companies make chargers, battery packs, cables, ...

t: r/Earbuds on Reddit: Whatever happened to MPOW??
s: October 31, 2021 - I have a pair of gaming headphones from Mpow called EG10. The purchase history is on my Amazon account, as I bought them in 2020, however, I do not see them listed on Amazon anymore. Furthermore; I cannot even find them on google. It is as though they are now a defunct brand.
